extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 8.3: How did Jeffersonians deal with the difficult problems of party politics and slavery?

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: FA Analyze 08 05

choices.content: provoked Federalists to charge Jefferson with unconstitutional expansionism
aroused Jeffersonian hostility to the Federalist judiciary and led to the repeal of the Judiciary Act of 1801
established the principle of judicial review of laws by the Supreme Court
created stability and continuity in the transition of power from one party to another

answer_2.response: Consider This: Neither Marbury’s defeat nor repeal of the Judiciary Act placated extreme Republicans. They insisted that federal judges be made more responsive to the will of the people. One solution, short of electing federal judges, was impeachment. See L.O. 8.3 How did Jeffersonians deal with the difficult problems of party politics and slavery?
